description.narrative: 1. Expanding Access to Finance in a Post-Conflict Frontier Country: Political uncertainty over the last 3 decades had limited the Sri Lankan government''s capacity to support the MSME sector and thereby to allocate crucial resources to boost lagging incomes. The proposed project will help in addressing this constraint by funding the Bank''s operations/expansion and promoting financial inclusion by means of financing of MSMEs. 2. Private Sector Development: The proposed Project would facilitate private sector development via access to credit for growing SMEs in Sri Lanka. Given the importance of SMEs in Sri Lanka, the cascading effect of this finance would go a long way in creating employment, reducing poverty and stimulating the economy.

National Development Bank PLC (NDB or Bank) is a mid-sized private bank in Sri Lanka. The proposed IFC project consists of: (a) an up to 7-year Senior A Loan of up to US$ 20 million for IFCs own account to support the Banks lending program to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Sri Lanka as well as a debt syndication of (b) parallel loans for the amount of up to US$ 60 million and (c) B loans for the amount of up to US$ 75 million.
